intro: Oisodix reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its intricate, reticulate venation pattern on its leaves, which gives it its scientific name. The plant produces small, pale yellow or greenish-white flowers with a subtle fragrance, typically blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Oisodix reticulata is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
